Shelby Clark
Sharing Economy Pioneer | Founder @ Turo | Consultant and Speaker
January 24, 2010, Shelby reported directly to Premal

Premal is an absolute rockstar. His enthusiasm is contagious, and working with him is an inspiring experience. In the early days at Kiva, the odds were against us, but he believed in the vision of Kiva and pushed each of us to perform to our best. We were a small, scrappy, grossly underresourced team, but Premal was able to rally the few troops that we had and push us to pull of something incredible. If you ever have the chance to work with Premal, I think you're crazy if you pass it by.

Reid Hoffman
Entrepreneur.  Product Strategist.  Investor.
May 18, 2007, Reid was senior to Premal but didn’t manage directly

Premal brings all of the skills and abilities of a driven, accomplished silicon valley entrepreneur to the unique organization of Kiva.  As an entrepreneur, Premal already has the essential characteristics: smart and analytic, fast and responsive, intelligent risk taking, focus.  He applies those essential characteristics to Kiva in that he also understands and cares about the *marketplace* of micro-finance, changing the world through enabling entrepreneurs -- and thus making real sustainable inroads to the problem of poverty.  Finally, and not least, he's also a pleasure to work with a second time.

Dave McClure
April 30, 2007, Dave worked with Premal in different groups

Premal is a passionate, tireless, & exceptional young lion in the field of microfinance.  After working with Premal for several years at PayPal, i was inspired to see him join & help lead Kiva's management team. His expertise in product development & financial services are well-matched to Kiva's mission connecting micro-entrepreneurs around the world with capital.  Premal has played a substantial role in Kiva's early success, and in developing business partnerships with eBay, Google, Microsoft, among others.  It's been a pleasure working with Kiva as a technical advisor, and i look forward to continuing my work with him & the team.

Stacey Vice
Office Manager Extraodinaire & Creative Events Organisation
April 17, 2014, Premal was senior to Stacey but didn’t manage directly

Stacey was an exceptional office manager while at Kiva.  We fully trusted her to help the office function and up our game as Kiva scaled both the number of people and programs to create a strong culture.  Stacey just plain cares more about doing quality work.  And she cares about people in a way that makes her earn the trust of employees.  Each month we have an all staff meeting where anyone in the company can give kudos to anyone else for the work they do.  Stacey I believe set a world record for the amount of love she received from the Kiva team at each of these meetings.  She's exceptional and were it not for personal circumstances that required her to relocate back to Australia, we would have loved for her to stay and continue leading as our office manager through attention to details, strong follow through and caring about people.  We miss her.  Would hire without reservation.

summary: Premal Shah leads Kiva.org, a non-profit website that connects people through lending to alleviate poverty.  Since 2005, over 1 million small businesses in + 75 countries have been financed by Kiva lenders.  The site has been named as one of Oprah's Favorite Things and a Top 50 Website by TIME Magazine.  Premal's inspiration for Kiva came when he was volunteering in a slum in India while on leave from PayPal, where he had been an early employee and Principal Product Manager.  For his work as a social entrepreneur, Premal was named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum and selected to FORTUNE magazine’s “Top 40 under 40″ list. Premal began his career as a management consultant and graduated from Stanford University.
name: Premal Shah
title: President, Kiva.org
